alert.note: Alert for Central Brewster County; Chinati Mountains; Chisos Basin; Crane; Lower Brewster County; Marfa Plateau; Pecos; Presidio Valley; Terrell; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 28 at 2:19PM CST until March 01 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR MUCH OF THE PERMIAN BASIN, UPPER TRANS PECOS, SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, AND THE DAVIS MOUNTAINS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MOST OF WEST TEXAS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR THE HWY 54 CORRIDOR, LOWER TRANS PECOS, MARFA PLATEAU, PRESIDIO VALLEY, AND BIG BEND REGION... * AFFECTED AREA...Crane, Pecos, Terrell, Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor, Chinati Mountains, Marfa Plateau, Central Brewster County, Chisos Basin, Presidio Valley and Lower Brewster County. * TIMING...Late Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 9 percent. * RFTI...7 or extreme. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions may have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires. Ensure that chains attached to trailers will not touch the pavement, thereby eliminating the possibility to generate sparks.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Central Brewster County; Chinati Mountains; Chisos Basin; Crane; Lower Brewster County; Marfa Plateau; Pecos; Presidio Valley; Terrell; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
